original_solution_mapping.L1: Animals were seen 26 times in January and three times as much in February, 26 x 3 = <<26*3=78>>78 times animals were seen in February.
original_solution_mapping.L2: In March the animals were seen 1/2 as many times as were seen in February, 78 / 2 = <<78/2=39>>39 times animals were seen in March.
original_solution_mapping.L3: If animals were seen 26 times in January + 78 times in February + 39 times in March = <<26+78+39=143>>143 times animals were seen in the first three months of the year.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5585.
    Returns: the total number of times families saw an animal in the first three months of the year.
    """
    # L1
    january_sightings = 26 # 26 times
    february_multiplier = 3 # three times as many
    february_sightings = january_sightings * february_multiplier

    # L2
    march_divisor = 2 # 1/2 as many times
    march_sightings = february_sightings / march_divisor

    # L3
    total_sightings = january_sightings + february_sightings + march_sightings

    # FA
    answer = total_sightings
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Animals were seen {january_sightings} times in January and three times as much in February, {january_sightings} x {february_multiplier} = <<{january_sightings}*{february_multiplier}={february_sightings}>>{february_sightings} times animals were seen in February.

In March the animals were seen 1/2 as many times as were seen in February, {february_sightings} / {march_divisor} = <<{february_sightings}/{march_divisor}={march_sightings}>>{march_sightings} times animals were seen in March.

If animals were seen {january_sightings} times in January + {february_sightings} times in February + {march_sightings} times in March = <<{january_sightings}+{february_sightings}+{march_sightings}={total_sightings}>>{total_sightings} times animals were seen in the first three months of the year.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: In March the animals were seen 1/2 as many times as were seen in February, 78 / 26 = <<78/26=3>>3 times animals were seen in March.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If animals were seen 26 times in January + 78 times in February + 3 times in March = <<26+78+3=107>>107 times animals were seen in the first three months of the year.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'january_sightings' (26) was used instead of 'march_divisor' (2).
